title: Amiri Decision No. (43) of 2022 on the Organizational Structure of the Ministry of Social Development and Family
title_en: Amiri Decision No. (43) of 2022 on the Organizational Structure of the Ministry of Social Development and Family
short_name: Amiri Decision No. (43) of 2022 on the Organizational Structure of the Ministry of Social Development and Family
description: Official legislation text retrieved from Al Meezan Legal Portal (English laws list source).

provisions.title: Article (1)
provisions.content: The organizational structure of the Ministry of Social Development and Family shall consist of the administrative units indicated in the organizational chart attached to this Decision, namely:

provisions.title: Article (2)
provisions.content:
The Technical Office shall be responsible for the following:
Providing technical opinions on matters referred to it by the Minister.
Studying and evaluating reports, projects, and programs related to the Ministry’s activities that are referred to by the Minister.
Researching, studying, and following up on matters referred to by the Minister, in coordination with the relevant administrative units.
Preparing summaries of topics, reports, and studies that need to be presented to the Minister and providing opinions thereon.

provisions.title: Article (3)
provisions.content:
The Internal Audit Department shall be responsible for the following:
Preparing the Ministry’s risk-based annual audit plan, submitting it to the Minister for approval, and preparing reports on audit findings.
Monitoring compliance with the implementation of laws, regulations, and decisions governing the work.
Reviewing financial instructions, proposing necessary amendments, and monitoring their implementation.
Monitoring administrative procedures, including employee appointments, leaves, promotions, and other personnel matters, and verifying compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and decisions.
Monitoring financial and accounting operations, disbursement vouchers, and recordkeeping procedures, and ensuring adherence to approved accounting standards.
Assessing risks related to financial and administrative audits and proposing measures to mitigate them.
Following up on corrective actions required from relevant administrative units based on audit results and preparing periodic reports thereon.
Ensuring the integrity of funds, assets, furniture, equipment, buildings, and other items owned by or under the supervision of the Ministry.
Participating in periodic and surprise inventory checks of stores and assets, ensuring accurate recordkeeping and proper implementation of procedures.
Following up on reports issued by oversight bodies and providing appropriate recommendations in response.

provisions.title: Article (4)
provisions.content:
The International Cooperation Department shall be responsible for the following:
Preparing working papers related to local, regional, and international
conferences, seminars, and meetings concerning the Ministry’s activities, in
coordination with the relevant administrative units and competent authorities.
Coordinating preparations for participation in conferences and meetings held by regional and international organizations and bodies specialized in the Ministry’s fields of work, in which the State is a member.
Preparing reports and responses requested by regional and international organizations and bodies concerning the Ministry’s activities, in coordination with the relevant administrative units.
Studying and following up on the implementation of recommendations issued by regional and international organizations related to the Ministry’s fields of work, in coordination with the competent national authorities.
Preparing the necessary reports on the contributions of regional and
international organizations and bodies in developing and supporting various activities within the Ministry’s scope of work, in coordination with the relevant authorities.
Following up on the State’s financial contributions to organizations working in the Ministry’s areas of responsibility, in coordination with the competent
authorities.
Exploring mechanisms to enhance the State’s role in the Ministry’s fields of work with Arab, regional, and international organizations.
Collecting and disseminating information and research issued by organizations and bodies related to the Ministry’s areas of concern at the local, regional, and
international levels, for the purpose of knowledge sharing and benefit.
Translating documents, books, scientific studies, and foreign correspondences relevant to the Ministry’s areas of specialization.

provisions.title: Article (5)
provisions.content:
The Planning, Quality, and Innovation Department shall be responsible for the following:
Preparing the Ministry’s strategic plan in coordination with relevant authorities and administrative units and taking the necessary steps for its approval.
Identifying existing challenges, determining and assessing potential institutional risks that may affect the achievement of the Ministry’s objectives, and submitting recommendations in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Managing and preparing alternative plans to ensure the continuity of operations in the Ministry during emergencies and crises, in coordination with the relevant administrative units as per their areas of competence.
Submitting implementation plans, projects, and programs of the various administrative units for the Minister’s approval.
Monitoring the implementation of plans related to the Ministry’s activities, evaluating outcomes, and submitting periodic reports thereon.
Studying the problems and obstacles hindering the implementation of the strategic and operational plans and proposing appropriate solutions.
Evaluating the quality of services provided by the administrative units, in coordination with the competent authority.
Reviewing and assessing the quality of performance at the level of administrative units and proposing measures to improve their overall efficiency.
Ensuring that work systems and procedures align with the Ministry’s mandates and objectives and proposing development plans to enhance these systems and simplify procedures, in coordination with the relevant units and authority.
Studying work-related issues and obstacles within the Ministry, analyzing their causes, and proposing suitable solutions.
Receiving, reviewing, and assessing initiatives, proposals, and innovative ideas in coordination with relevant units and competent authority.
Monitoring, collecting, and analyzing statistical data related to the Ministry’s activities and coordinating with the concerned units on the statistical reports required from the Ministry.
Coordinating with relevant administrative units and competent authorities regarding international indicators related to the Ministry’s fields of work and mandates.

provisions.title: Article (6)
provisions.content:
The Legal Affairs Department shall be responsible for the following:
Examining, studying, and following up on legal matters related to the Ministry’s activities, in coordination with the relevant administrative units.
Preparing draft legislative instruments related to the Ministry, and providing legal opinions on draft laws referred to it.
Providing legal opinions on matters referred to it.
Preparing drafts of contracts, agreements, and memoranda of understanding related to the Ministry’s areas of competence, in coordination with the relevant administrative units.
Investigating incidents and violations attributed to Ministry employees,
preparing the necessary reports on the investigation outcomes, accompanied by legal opinions and recommendations, submitting them to the competent
authority, and following up on the implementation of decisions issued in this regard.
Following up on disputes and legal cases in which the Ministry is a party, in coordination with the competent authorities.

provisions.title: Article (7)
provisions.content:
The Public Relations and Communications Department shall be responsible for the following:
Issuing publications and media programs aimed at introducing the Ministry’s role, activities, and competencies, in coordination with the relevant
administrative units.
Monitoring and tracking what is published in newspapers, media outlets, and social media platforms concerning the Ministry and its areas of competence,
presenting them to officials, and preparing appropriate responses in coordination with the relevant administrative units and competent authorities.
Coordinating with the relevant administrative units to develop awareness and
educational plans and programs, and implementing them through various events and activities, in coordination with concerned entities.
Receiving inquiries and complaints from the public, referring them to the concerned administrative units, and responding to their queries.
Arranging travel, hospitality, and accommodation for the Ministry’s guests and visiting or departing delegations, in coordination with the relevant administrative units.
Organizing cultural, social, and sports activities for Ministry employees, and supervising celebrations organized or attended by the Ministry.
Organizing conferences, seminars, and exhibitions held by the Ministry, and
preparing the necessary budget for such events, in coordination with the relevant administrative units.
Receiving requests from elderly individuals and persons with disabilities, in coordination with the competent administrative units, to process their
transactions and resolve any issues or difficulties they may face.

provisions.title: Article (8)
provisions.content:
The Human Resources Department shall be responsible for the following:
Implementing the laws, regulations, and systems related to personnel affairs.
Preparing studies on human resource planning within the Ministry and identifying the Ministry’s staffing needs, in coordination with the competent authority and various administrative units.
Preparing job descriptions, classifications, and grading proposals, following up on their implementation, and updating them as necessary.
Preparing the draft budget for Chapter One (salaries and wages), in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Implementing employee performance appraisal procedures.
Executing procedures for appointment, transfer, secondment, and delegation.
Studying employees’ eligibility for leave in accordance with the law.
Preparing studies related to the Ministry’s job structure and submitting proposals for improving the administrative organization.
Identifying training needs for the Ministry’s employees, coordinating with the relevant administrative units, following up on training implementation, and evaluating its effectiveness.
Taking necessary actions for the allocation of government housing and the
disbursement of furniture allowances to Ministry staff, in coordination with the competent authorities.
Establishing and updating databases related to the Ministry’s personnel affairs.

provisions.title: Article (9)
provisions.content:
The Financial and Administrative Affairs Department shall be responsible for the following:
Implementing financial and administrative laws, regulations, and systems related to the Ministry’s operations.
Preparing the Ministry’s draft annual budget and its final accounts, in coordination with the relevant administrative units.
Providing the Ministry and its various administrative units with the necessary
supplies and equipment to carry out their duties, in coordination with the units concerned.
Carrying out procurement, tenders, and auctions in accordance with applicable laws and regulations in the State.
Supervising the implementation of budget appropriations and auditing revenue and expenditure accounts.
Receiving, dispatching, classifying, and registering incoming and outgoing mail.
Organizing the Ministry’s archive and preserving documents using modern methods.
Preparing payment vouchers and all other financial transactions.
Collecting fees and charges for services provided by the Ministry.
Performing all administrative support services.
Supervising the Ministry’s warehouses.

provisions.title: Article (10)
provisions.content:
The Information Systems Department shall be responsible for the following:
Developing plans and policies for the use of computer systems in the Ministry’s activities and following up on their implementation.
Programming, storing, retrieving, and developing information systems and data necessary for the Ministry’s operations.
Securing systems, software, networks, and information technology infrastructure against the risks of cyber incidents.
Preparing disaster recovery plans to address or mitigate the effects of cyber incidents, or to prevent or manage their escalation, in accordance with
information security policies and guidelines, in coordination with the competent authority.
Providing and maintaining the hardware, software, and electronic networks required for the Ministry’s automated work systems, in coordination with the relevant administrative units.
Designing, operating, and managing databases and information systems of various types.
Providing technical support to users of the Ministry’s electronic networks and training them on the use of systems, programs, computer devices, and
accessories.
Creating, maintaining, and regularly updating the Ministry’s website on the global information network (internet).

provisions.title: Article (11)
provisions.content:
The Social Security Department shall be responsible for the following:
Receiving and reviewing applications for social security services and other social assistance programs.
Assessing the eligibility of beneficiaries for social security pensions and
determining the amount in accordance with applicable entitlement conditions and regulations.
Monitoring the status of social security beneficiaries to ensure continued compliance with eligibility requirements.
Taking the necessary measures to implement programs aimed at rehabilitating beneficiaries of the social security system, in accordance with the provisions of the law and in coordination with the competent authorities.
Preparing studies and research in the field of social security and insurance and drafting the necessary reports.
Providing urgent relief services to those affected by disasters, in accordance with applicable laws and regulations, and in coordination with the competent
authorities in the State.

provisions.title: Article (12)
provisions.content:
The Community Development Department shall be responsible for the following:
Proposing policies, strategies, and national plans related to social development, in coordination with relevant authorities and the Ministry’s concerned
administrative units.
Issuing regulatory guidelines and instructions for social service providers in the State, cooperating with them in their implementation, and providing the
necessary support to enhance their capabilities.
Organizing and developing social work in accordance with national and international standards, in coordination with the concerned entities.
Establishing conditions and standards for the creation of social entities, in coordination with relevant authorities.
Monitoring and studying issues related to social development and social phenomena resulting from societal changes and proposing appropriate solutions to address them.
Preparing research and studies related to social work and community development and drafting the necessary reports.
Supporting social research and studies, in coordination with relevant entities.

provisions.title: Article (13)
provisions.content:
The Citizens’ Housing Department shall be responsible for the following:
Implementing the provisions of laws, regulations, and decisions related to housing.
Proposing and executing policies related to the housing system and the decisions enforcing them.
Conducting the necessary studies and research to formulate and develop housing policies in the State and preparing the related reports.
Proposing architectural models for housing, in coordination with the competent authorities.
Coordinating and cooperating with government entities and financial institutions whose activities relate to the functions of the Department.
Receiving and studying applications for housing benefits and taking the
necessary actions in accordance with applicable laws, rules, and procedures.
Receiving and addressing complaints related to housing benefits and resolving them in accordance with the provisions of the law.
Preparing and updating a database on citizens’ housing and issuing the necessary reports thereon.
Supervising the construction of housing units for those in need, taking necessary actions for building additions, maintaining, demolishing, or rebuilding
government housing units under the Department’s jurisdiction, and handing them over to eligible beneficiaries.

provisions.title: Article (14)
provisions.content:
The Associations and Private Institutions Department shall be responsible for the following:
Implementing the laws, regulations, and decisions related to associations and private institutions.
Registering and officially publishing associations and private institutions and supervising their activities.
Maintaining a file for each association or private institution, containing a copy of its founding contract or document (as applicable), its bylaws, registration certificate, and any decisions issued in its regard.
Receiving and reviewing requests for support submitted by associations and private institutions to help them carry out their work and achieve their
objectives.
Preparing studies and research related to associations and private institutions and drafting the necessary reports on them.
Organizing, developing, supervising, and monitoring voluntary social work.

provisions.title: Article (15)
provisions.content:
The Social Protection Department shall be responsible for the following:
Raising community awareness about the concept of social protection.
Supervising social care homes designated for the shelter, care, and rehabilitation of targeted groups.
Preparing and implementing social protection programs aimed at preventing
juvenile delinquency, rehabilitating offenders, and addressing social problems.
Taking the necessary measures to care for and protect children of unknown parentage.
Taking the necessary measures to promote social integration in coordination with competent governmental and non-governmental entities.
Assisting released prisoners, recovered addicts, and their families in adapting and integrating socially, in coordination with relevant governmental and non-
governmental authorities.
Providing a suitable environment, supportive social conditions, and employment opportunities for released individuals to prevent their return to delinquency, in coordination with relevant governmental and non-governmental entities.
Preparing studies and research related to social protection and issuing the necessary reports thereon.

provisions.title: Article (16)
provisions.content:
The Family Development Department shall be responsible for the following:
Preparing and implementing national strategies, plans, and policies related to the family, women, and children.
Raising community awareness about contemporary family and social challenges, their impacts, and methods of prevention.
Preparing and implementing projects and programs to develop and nurture children’s and youth’s creativity in cultural, educational, and recreational fields, in coordination with relevant governmental and non-governmental entities.
Implementing programs aimed at developing and enhancing women’s capacities, in cooperation with relevant governmental and non-governmental entities.
Raising awareness and educating the community on women’s and children’s
rights and implementing training programs for professionals working with these groups, in cooperation with relevant governmental and non-governmental
entities.
Organizing conferences, seminars, and workshops to address issues concerning the family, women, and children, in coordination with the competent
administrative unit.
Preparing studies and research related to family development and drafting the necessary reports.
Collecting and analyzing statistical data related to families, in coordination with the relevant administrative unit.

provisions.title: Article (17)
provisions.content:
The Community Care Department shall be responsible for the following:
Preparing and implementing national strategies, plans, and policies related to the elderly and persons with disabilities.
Developing and implementing the programs and services necessary for the care
and rehabilitation of the elderly and persons with disabilities, in cooperation with relevant governmental and non-governmental entities.
Raising community awareness and educating the public on the rights of the
elderly and persons with disabilities, and implementing training programs for
professionals working with them, in cooperation with the competent governmental and non-governmental authorities.
Proposing amendments to legislation related to the elderly and persons with disabilities, in cooperation with the relevant department within the Ministry.
Equipping persons with disabilities with the necessary social skills to adapt and integrate into society.
Organizing courses, conferences, and workshops to discuss issues concerning the elderly and persons with disabilities, in coordination with relevant entities.
Preparing a comprehensive database of information and statistics related to the elderly and persons with disabilities.
Preparing studies and research concerning the elderly and persons with disabilities, and issuing the necessary reports thereon.

provisions.title: Article (18)
provisions.content:
The Family Empowerment Department shall be responsible for the following:
Supporting and encouraging development projects aimed at economically empowering individuals and families, in coordination with relevant entities.
Guiding and encouraging the efforts of the private sector and civil society organizations to establish or finance development projects for the economic empowerment of individuals and families.
Developing and implementing projects to support and grow productive families through training and the provision of auxiliary services.
Providing suitable avenues and opportunities for marketing the products of individuals and productive families.
Promoting family saving and rational consumption.
Providing guidance, counseling, technical consultations, and necessary support to help productive families achieve stability.
Preparing statistics, studies, and research related to the target groups of individuals and families for empowerment.

provisions.title: Article (19)
provisions.content: A decision by the Minister shall be issued to define the competencies of the Minister’s Office, the Office of the Undersecretary, and the Office of the Assistant Undersecretary.

provisions.title: Article (20)
provisions.content:
The Council of Ministers may, upon the proposal of the Minister, issue a decision to
amend the structure of the administrative units that make up the Ministry by addition, deletion, or merger, and to assign or amend their functions.

provisions.title: Article (21)
provisions.content:
The Minister may, by decision, establish sections within the Ministry’s administrative
units as required by public interest, or cancel or merge them, assign their functions, and amend them. However, such a decision shall not be effective until it is approved by the Council of Ministers.

provisions.title: Article (22)
provisions.content: All competent authorities, each within its jurisdiction, shall implement this Decision. It shall come into force from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.
